page.title: 18HEDGEROWS
page.content: One of the special features of the area, and indeed of the whole of The South Hams, is the beauty and richness of the hedgerows or Devon banks. From early March, when the first of the primroses appear, until July when the foxgloves are 'going over' there is a succession of colour. Among the primroses, which are abundant in many places, are celandines and violets between the unfolding ferns. Tall Alexanders then Queen Anne's lace quickly grow. In May bluebells, red campion and stitchwort give a patriotic colour scheme to the roadsides. Closely trimmed sycamore shoots break into varied red and brick coloured young leaves. This beauty is fragile and must be cherished. We must guard against hedge destruction, chemical sprays that only encourage grasses, and early trimming.
